column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Let me clarify by saying that
column2: if I could give partial stars
column3: I'd give Jinya a 3 1/2 or 3 Â 1/4. I had a craving from ramen and decided to find the nearest place to campus to get my fix
column4: that place ended up being Jinya. After a quick glance at the reviews
column5: I decided to give it a chance. I ordered the Jinya #1 (the Tonkotsu Black) with the suggested accompaniments (corn and a spicy ground pork). The ramen itself was quite good
column6: the broth a nice mixture of spicy
column8: and savory. My one complaint is that they added too much corn to the soup; while a nice compliment
column9: the corn's strong flavor overwhelmed some of the broth's subtler flavors.
